00109 int
00110 get_server_portnumber(struct context *ctx)
00111 {
00112         char *s;
00113         s = getenv(SERVERNAME_ENVVAR);
00114         if (s == NULL)
00115                 return 1;
00116         if (strlen(s) == 0)
00117                 return 1;
00118         strcpy(ctx->peername, s);
00119         s = getenv(PORTNUMBER_ENVVAR);
00120         if (s == NULL)
00121                 return 1;
00122         ctx->portnumber = atoi(s);
00123         return 0;
00124 }

00133 void
00134 print_element(struct element *e)
00135 {
00136         int i, n, too_long, tag = e->tag;
00137         unsigned char *s;
00138         const int max_str_len = 16;
00139         switch (tag) {
00140         case 'i':
00141                 logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, "%d", e->data.i);
00142                 break;
00143         case 'd':
00144                 logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, "%f", e->data.d);
00145                 break;
00146         case 's':
00147                 s = (unsigned char*)e->data.s.ptr;
00148                 n = e->data.s.len;
00149                 too_long = 0;
00150                 if (n > max_str_len) {
00151                         n = max_str_len;
00152                         too_long = 1;
00153                 }
00154                 logbuf[logptr++] = '"';
00155                 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00156                         if (s[i] >= ' ' && s[i] <= '~') {
00157                                 logbuf[logptr++] = s[i];
00158                         }
00159                         else {
00160                                 logptr +=
00161                                         sprintf(logbuf + logptr,
00162                                                 "\\%02X", s[i]);
00163                         }
00164                 }
00165                 if (too_long) {
00166                         logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, " ...");
00167                 }
00168                 logbuf[logptr++] = '"';
00169                 break;
00170         case 't':
00171                 print_tuple(e->data.t);
00172                 break;
00173         case '?':
00174                 logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, "???");
00175                 break;
00176         default:
00177                 logptr +=
00178                         sprintf(logbuf + logptr,
00179                                 "<<unknown field, tag=%d>>", tag);
00180                 break;
00181         }
00182 }

00184 
00188 void
00189 print_element_stderr(struct element *e)
00190 {
00191         int i, n, too_long, tag = e->tag;
00192         unsigned char *s;
00193         const int max_str_len = 16;
00194         switch (tag) {
00195         case 'i':
00196                 fprintf(stderr,"%d", e->data.i);
00197                 break;
00198         case 'd':
00199                 fprintf(stderr,"%f", e->data.d);
00200                 break;
00201         case 's':
00202                 s = (unsigned char*)e->data.s.ptr;
00203                 n = e->data.s.len;
00204                 too_long = 0;
00205                 if (n > max_str_len) {
00206                         n = max_str_len;
00207                         too_long = 1;
00208                 }
00209                 fprintf(stderr,"'");
00210                 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00211                         if (s[i] >= ' ' && s[i] <= '~') {
00212                                 fprintf(stderr,"%c",s[i]);
00213                         }
00214                         else {
00215                                 fprintf(stderr,"\\%02X", s[i]);
00216                         }
00217                 }
00218                 if (too_long) {
00219                         fprintf(stderr," ...");
00220                 }
00221                 fprintf(stderr,"'");
00222                 break;
00223         case 't':
00224                 print_tuple_stderr(e->data.t);
00225                 break;
00226         case '?':
00227                 fprintf(stderr,"???");
00228                 break;
00229         }
00230 }
00231 
00235 void
00236 print_tuple(struct tuple *s)
00237 {
00238         int i, n, flag = 0;
00239         if (logptr >= LOGBUFSIZE-128)
00240                 return;
00241         logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, "(");
00242         n = s->num_elts;
00243         assert(n);
00244         if (n > 10) {
00245                 n = 10;
00246                 flag = 1;
00247         }
00248         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00249                 if (i > 0) logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, ", ");
00250                 print_element(&s->elements[i]);
00251         }
00252         if (flag) {
00253                 logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, ".... ");
00254         }
00255         logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, ")\n");
00256 }
00257 
00258 
00262 void
00263 print_tuple_stderr(struct tuple *s)
00264 {
00265         int i, n, flag = 0;
00266         logptr += sprintf(logbuf + logptr, "(");
00267         fprintf(stderr,"(");
00268         n = s->num_elts;
00269         assert(n);
00270         if (n > 10) {
00271                 n = 10;
00272                 flag = 1;
00273         }
00274         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00275                 if (i > 0) fprintf(stderr, ", ");
00276                 print_element_stderr(&s->elements[i]);
00277         }
00278         if (flag) {
00279                 fprintf(stderr, ".... ");
00280         }
00281         fprintf(stderr,")");
00282 }

00291 static struct tuple *
00292 make_tuple_internal(char *fmt, va_list ap)
00293 {
00294         int i, elt_index, len;
00295         double d;
00296         char *s;
00297         struct tuple *t;
00298 
00299         t = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple));
00300         if (t == NULL) {
00301                 PERROR("malloc failed");
00302                 EXIT();
00303         }
00304         t->num_elts = 0;
00305         t->string_space = NULL;
00306         for (s = fmt; *s; s++) {
00307                 if (*s != '#')
00308                         t->num_elts++;
00309         }
00310         t->elements = malloc(t->num_elts * sizeof(struct element));
00311         if (t->elements == NULL) {
00312                 PERROR("malloc failed");
00313                 EXIT();
00314         }
00315 
00316         elt_index = 0;
00317         while (*fmt) {
00318                 t->elements[elt_index].tag = *fmt;
00319                 switch (*fmt++) {
00320                 case '?':
00321                         /*
00322                          * nothing from the va_arg list 
00323                          */
00324                         break;
00325                 case 'i':
00326                         i = va_arg(ap, int);
00327                         t->elements[elt_index].data.i = i;
00328                         break;
00329                 case 'd':
00330                         d = va_arg(ap, double);
00331                         t->elements[elt_index].data.d = d;
00332                         break;
00333                 case 't':
00334                         t->elements[elt_index].data.t = (struct tuple*) malloc(sizeof(struct tuple));
00335                         make_tuple_internal(fmt, ap);
00336                         break;
00337                 case 's':
00338                         s = va_arg(ap, char *);
00339                         if (*fmt == '#') {
00340                                 /*
00341                                  * string with length 
00342                                  */
00343                                 len = va_arg(ap, int);
00344                                 fmt++;
00345                         }
00346                         else {
00347                                 /*
00348                                  * zero-terminated string 
00349                                  */
00350                                 len = strlen(s);
00351                         }
00352                         t->elements[elt_index].data.s.ptr = s;
00353                         t->elements[elt_index].data.s.len = len;
00354                         break;
00355                 }
00356                 elt_index++;
00357         }
00358         return t;
00359 }
00360 
00365 struct tuple *
00366 make_tuple(char *fmt, ...)
00367 {
00368         struct tuple *t;
00369         va_list ap;
00370         va_start(ap, fmt);
00371         t = make_tuple_internal(fmt, ap);
00372         va_end(ap);
00373         return t;
00374 }

00380 void
00381 destroy_tuple(struct tuple *t)
00382 {
00383         if (t != NULL) {
00384                 free(t->elements);
00385                 if (t->string_space != NULL)
00386                         free(t->string_space);
00387                 free(t);
00388         }
00389 }

00391 
00395 int
00396 tuples_match(struct tuple *s, struct tuple *t)
00397 {
00398         int i, num_elts;
00399         num_elts = s->num_elts;
00400         if (num_elts != t->num_elts)
00401                 return 0;
00402         for (i = 0; i < num_elts; i++) {
00403                 int s_tag = s->elements[i].tag;
00404                 int t_tag = t->elements[i].tag;
00405 
00406                 if (s_tag != '?' && t_tag != '?') {
00407                         if (s_tag != t_tag)
00408                                 return 0;
00409                         switch (s_tag) {
00410                         case 'i':
00411                                 if (s->elements[i].data.i !=
00412                                     t->elements[i].data.i)
00413                                         return 0;
00414                                 break;
00415                         case 'd':
00416                                 if (s->elements[i].data.d !=
00417                                     t->elements[i].data.d)
00418                                         return 0;
00419                                 break;
00420                         case 's':
00421                                 if (s->elements[i].data.s.len !=
00422                                     t->elements[i].data.s.len)
00423                                         return 0;
00424                                 if (strncmp(s->elements[i].data.s.ptr,
00425                                             t->elements[i].data.s.ptr,
00426                                             s->elements[i].data.s.len) != 0)
00427                                         return 0;
00428                                 break;
00429                         case 't':
00430                                 if (! tuples_match(
00431                                         s->elements[i].data.t,
00432                                         t->elements[i].data.t))
00433                                         return 0;
00434                         default:
00435                                 break;
00436                         }
00437                 }
00438         }
00439         return 1;
00440 }

00452 unsigned int
00453 random_int(void)
00454 {
00455         int x, sock;
00456         sock = open("/dev/urandom", O_RDONLY);
00457         read(sock, &x, sizeof(int));
00458         close(sock);
00459         return x;
00460 }

00466 
00470 int
00471 send_chunk(struct context *ctx, char *buf, int bytes_to_send)
00472 {
00473         while (bytes_to_send) {
00474                 int sent, masks = 0;
00475                 /*
00476                  * The server should not get a SIGPIPE if a client
00477                  * dies, because then it will stop running. But we
00478                  * want clients to stop running (Broken pipe) if the
00479                  * server stops.
00480                  */
00481                 if (i_am_server)
00482                         masks = MSG_NOSIGNAL;
00483                 sent = send(ctx->sock, buf, bytes_to_send, masks);
00484                 if (sent < 0) {
00485                         PERROR("send failed");
00486                         PRINTF("ctx->id=%d, bytes_to_send=%d\n",ctx->id,bytes_to_send);
00487                         return 1;
00488                 }
00489                 buf += sent;
00490                 bytes_to_send -= sent;
00491                 sched_yield();
00492         }
00493         return 0;
00494 }
00495 
00496 
00500 int
00501 send_tuple(struct context *ctx, struct tuple *t)
00502 {
00503         int i, string_length;
00504         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &t->num_elts, sizeof(int))) {
00505                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00506                 return 1;
00507         }
00508         string_length = 0;
00509         for (i = 0; i < t->num_elts; i++) {
00510                 if (t->elements[i].tag == 's') {
00511                         string_length += t->elements[i].data.s.len;
00512                 }
00513         }
00514         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &string_length, sizeof(int))) {
00515                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00516                 return 1;
00517         }
00518 
00519         string_length = 0;
00520         //fprintf(stderr,"Sending %d elts\n", t->num_elts);
00521         for (i = 0; i < t->num_elts; i++) {
00522                 struct element *e = &t->elements[i];
00523                 //fprintf(stderr,"Sending elt %c\n", e->tag);
00524                 if (e->tag == 's') {
00525                         /*
00526                          * translate pointers into indexes 
00527                          */
00528                         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &e->tag, sizeof(int))) {
00529                                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00530                                 return 1;
00531                         }
00532                         if (send_chunk
00533                             (ctx, (char *) &string_length, sizeof(int))) {
00534                                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00535                                 return 1;
00536                         }
00537                         if (send_chunk
00538                             (ctx, (char *) &e->data.s.len, sizeof(int))) {
00539                                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00540                                 return 1;
00541                         }
00542                         string_length += e->data.s.len;
00543                 }
00544                 else {
00545                         if (send_chunk
00546                             (ctx, (char *) e, sizeof(struct element))) {
00547                                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00548                                 return 1;
00549                         }
00550                         if (e->tag == 't') {
00551                                 if (send_tuple(ctx, e->data.t)) {
00552                                         PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00553                                         return 1;
00554                                 }
00555                         }
00556                 }
00557         }
00558 
00559         for (i = 0; i < t->num_elts; i++) {
00560                 if (t->elements[i].tag == 's') {
00561                         if (send_chunk(ctx,
00562                                        (char *) t->elements[i].data.s.
00563                                        ptr, t->elements[i].data.s.len)) {
00564                                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
00565                                 return 1;
00566                         }
00567                 }
00568         }
00569         return 0;
00570 }
00571 
00572 
00576 int
00577 recv_chunk(struct context *ctx, char *buf, int size)
00578 {
00579         int gotten;
00580         int togo=size;
00581         /*
00582          * The server should not quit if a client dies, But we want
00583          * clients to stop running (Broken pipe) if the server stops,
00584          * or at least pass an error message up to whoever called
00585          * down here.
00586          * 
00587          * I had intended to use MSG_NOSIGNAL as a mask argument to
00588          * recv() for this purpose, but it turns out that the signal
00589          * only kills that thread, not the whole server, and that's
00590          * exactly the desired behavior.
00591          *
00592          * Although I don't know if it puts the thread in some wierd
00593          * limbo state, leaving the entry in tuple_server.c's
00594          * client_list unuseable. This will be something to
00595          * investigate as time permits.
00596          */
00597         while (togo>0)
00598         {
00599                 gotten = recv(ctx->sock, buf+size-togo, togo, MSG_WAITALL);
00600                 if (gotten == 0) {
00601                         // peer did an orderly shutdown
00602                         PRINTF("%s did orderly shutdown. togo=%d, gotten=%d, ctx->id=%d\n", i_am_server ? "Client" : "Server", togo, gotten, ctx->id);
00603                         return 1; // signal failure
00604                 }
00605                 if (gotten < 0) {
00606                         PRINTF("%s broke connection? ctx.id=%d\n", i_am_server ? "Client" : "Server", ctx->id);
00607                         PERROR("recv failed");
00608                         PRINTF("retry result = %d\n", recv(ctx->sock, buf+size-togo, togo, MSG_WAITALL));
00609                         PERROR("retry of recv failed");
00610                         return 1; // signal failure
00611                 }
00612                 if (gotten < togo)
00613                 {
00614                         PRINTF("partial receive: %d of %d bytes\n", gotten, togo);
00615                 }
00616                 togo -= gotten;
00617         }
00618         return 0; // signal success
00619 }
00620 
00621 
00625 struct tuple *
00626 recv_tuple(struct context *ctx)
00627 {
00628         struct tuple *s;
00629         int i, num_elts, string_length, element_size;
00630 
00631         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &num_elts, sizeof(int))) {
00632                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
00633                 return NULL;
00634         }
00635 
00636         /*
00637          * return code for non-blocking gets and reads 
00638          */
00639         if (num_elts == -1) {
00640                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
00641         }
00642 
00643         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &string_length, sizeof(int))) {
00644                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
00645                 return NULL;
00646         }
00647         assert(string_length >= 0);
00648 
00649         s = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple));
00650         if (s == NULL) {
00651                 PERROR("malloc failed");
00652                 EXIT();
00653         }
00654         s->num_elts = num_elts;
00655         s->string_length = string_length;
00656 
00657         element_size = num_elts * sizeof(struct element);
00658         s->elements = malloc(element_size);
00659         if (s->elements == NULL) {
00660                 PERROR("malloc failed");
00661                 EXIT();
00662         }
00663 
00664         // Recursively receive all the elements
00665         for (i=0; i<num_elts; i++) {
00666                 if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) (s->elements+i), sizeof(struct element))) {
00667                         PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
00668                         PRINTF("element %d of %d was not received\n", i, num_elts);
00669                         return NULL;
00670                 }
00671                 if (s->elements[i].tag == 't') {
00672                         struct tuple *nested_tuple = recv_tuple(ctx);
00673                         if (!nested_tuple)
00674                         {
00675                                 PRINTF("Could not receive a nested tuple\n");
00676                                 return NULL;
00677                         }
00678                         s->elements[i].data.t = nested_tuple;
00679                 }
00680         }
00681 
00682         if (string_length) {
00683                 s->string_space = malloc(string_length);
00684                 if (s->string_space == NULL) {
00685                         PERROR("malloc failed");
00686                         EXIT();
00687                 }
00688                 if (recv_chunk(ctx, s->string_space, string_length)) {
00689                         PRINTF("recv_chunk failed for string data\n");
00690                         PRINTF("string_length=%d, num_elts=%d, string_space=%p(%s)\n", string_length, s->num_elts, s->string_space, s->string_space);
00691                         return NULL;
00692                 }
00693 
00694                 /*
00695                  * translate index values to pointers 
00696                  */
00697                 for (i = 0; i < num_elts; i++) {
00698                         if (s->elements[i].tag == 's') {
00699                                 int n = (int) s->elements[i].data.s.ptr;
00700                                 s->elements[i].data.s.ptr =
00701                                         s->string_space + n;
00702                         }
00703                 }
00704         }
00705         else {
00706                 s->string_space = NULL;
00707         }
00708         return s;
00709 }

00712 /*
00713  * ----------------------------------------------------------- 
00714  */
00715 
00719 static int
00720 open_client_socket(struct context *ctx)
00721 {
00722         struct sockaddr_in addr;
00723         static int context_id=1;
00724 //      int optval=1;
00725 
00726         ctx->id = context_id++;
00727         ctx->sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00728         if (ctx->sock < 0) {
00729                 PERROR("Can't create socket");
00730                 return 1;
00731         }
00732 #if 0
00733         /*
00734          * Set some socket options, so that we have fast response
00735          */
00736         if (setsockopt (ctx->sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, &optval, sizeof (optval))) {
00737                 PERROR("setsockopt failed on TCP_NODELAY");
00738                 return 1;
00739         }
00740 #endif
00741 
00742         /*
00743          * convert server name to dotted quad 
00744          */
00745         struct hostent *he = gethostbyname(ctx->peername);
00746         if (he == NULL) {
00747                 PERROR("connect failed (bad hostname?)");
00748                 return 1;
00749         }
00750         assert(he->h_addrtype == AF_INET);
00751         
00752         memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
00753         addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00754         addr.sin_addr.s_addr = ((struct in_addr *)he->h_addr_list[0])->s_addr;
00755         addr.sin_port = htons(ctx->portnumber);
00756 
00757         if (connect(ctx->sock, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) < 0) 
00758         {
00759                 PERROR("connect failed");
00760                 // When the system is flooded with lingering TIME_WAIT
00761                 // sockets, I hit a EADDRNOTAVAIL here.
00762                 fprintf
00763                 (
00764                         stderr,
00765                         "connection to %d.%d.%d.%d:%d not possible\n",
00766                         (addr.sin_addr.s_addr >>  0) & 0xff,
00767                         (addr.sin_addr.s_addr >>  8) & 0xff,
00768                         (addr.sin_addr.s_addr >> 16) & 0xff,
00769                         (addr.sin_addr.s_addr >> 24) & 0xff,
00770                         ctx->portnumber
00771                 );
00772                 return 1;
00773         }
00774 
00775         return 0;
00776 }
00777 
00778 
00779 
00780 
00784 int
00785 put_tuple(struct tuple *s, struct context *ctx)
00786 {
00787         int op = PUT;
00788         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
00789                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
00790                 return 1;
00791         }
00792         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00793                 PERROR("send failed");
00794                 return 1;
00795         }
00796         if (send_tuple(ctx, s)) {
00797                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00798                 return 1;
00799         }
00800         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
00801         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00802 #if 1 // Why is this? - Bram
00803         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00804                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
00805                 return 1;
00806         }
00807         assert(op == PUT);
00808 #endif
00809         if (close(ctx->sock))
00810         {
00811                 PERROR("close failed");
00812         }
00813         ctx->id=0;
00814         ctx->sock=0;
00815         return 0;
00816 }
00817 
00818 
00822 int
00823 replace_tuple(struct tuple *template, struct tuple *replacement, struct context *ctx)
00824 {
00825         int op = REPLACE;
00826         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
00827                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
00828                 return 1;
00829         }
00830         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00831                 PERROR("send failed");
00832                 return 1;
00833         }
00834         if (send_tuple(ctx, template)) {
00835                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00836                 return 1;
00837         }
00838         if (send_tuple(ctx, replacement)) {
00839                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00840                 return 1;
00841         }
00842         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
00843         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00844         // Really necessary?
00845         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00846                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
00847                 return 1;
00848         }
00849         assert(op == REPLACE);
00850         if (close(ctx->sock))
00851         {
00852                 PERROR("close failed");
00853         }
00854         ctx->id=0;
00855         ctx->sock=0;
00856         return 0;
00857 }
00858 
00859 
00863 struct tuple *
00864 get_tuple(struct tuple *s, struct context *ctx)
00865 {
00866         int op = GET;
00867         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
00868                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
00869                 return NULL;
00870         }
00871         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00872                 PERROR("send failed");
00873                 return NULL;
00874         }
00875         if (send_tuple(ctx, s)) {
00876                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00877                 return NULL;
00878         }
00879         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
00880         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00881         DBGPRINTF("\n");
00882         s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00883         DBGPRINTF("s = %08x\n", (int) s);
00884         if (s == NULL) {
00885                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed");
00886                 return NULL;
00887         }
00888         if (s == (struct tuple *) -1) {
00889                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed");
00890                 return NULL;
00891         }
00892         if (close(ctx->sock))
00893         {
00894                 PERROR("close failed");
00895         }
00896         ctx->sock=0;
00897         ctx->id=0;
00898         return s;
00899 }
00900 
00901 
00905 struct tuple *
00906 read_tuple(struct tuple *template_tuple, struct context *ctx)
00907 {
00908         int op = READ;
00909         struct tuple *returned_tuple=0;
00910         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
00911                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
00912                 return NULL;
00913         }
00914         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00915                 PERROR("send failed");
00916                 return NULL;
00917         }
00918         if (send_tuple(ctx, template_tuple)) {
00919                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00920                 return NULL;
00921         }
00922         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
00923         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00924         DBGPRINTF("\n");
00925         returned_tuple = recv_tuple(ctx);
00926         DBGPRINTF("returned_tuple = %08x\n", (int) returned_tuple);
00927         if (returned_tuple == NULL) {
00928                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed for read");
00929                 print_tuple_stderr(template_tuple);
00930                 fprintf(stderr, " was the template.\n");
00931                 return NULL;
00932         }
00933         if (returned_tuple == (struct tuple *) -1) {
00934                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed for read");
00935                 print_tuple_stderr(template_tuple);
00936                 fprintf(stderr, " was the template.\n");
00937                 return NULL;
00938         }
00939         if (close(ctx->sock))
00940         {
00941                 PERROR("close failed");
00942         }
00943         ctx->sock=0;
00944         ctx->id=0;
00945         return returned_tuple;
00946 }
00947 
00948 
00952 struct tuple *
00953 get_nb_tuple(struct tuple *template_tuple, struct context *ctx)
00954 {
00955         int op = GET_NB;
00956         struct tuple *returned_tuple = 0;
00957         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
00958                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
00959                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
00960         }
00961         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
00962                 PERROR("send failed");
00963                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
00964         }
00965         if (send_tuple(ctx, template_tuple)) {
00966                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
00967                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
00968         }
00969         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
00970         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00971         returned_tuple = recv_tuple(ctx);
00972         if (returned_tuple == NULL) {
00973                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed for nonblocking get");
00974                 print_tuple_stderr(template_tuple);
00975                 fprintf(stderr, " was the template.\n");
00976                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
00977         }
00978         if (returned_tuple == (struct tuple *) -1) {
00979                 if (close(ctx->sock))
00980                 {
00981                         PERROR("close failed");
00982                 }
00983                 ctx->sock=0;
00984                 ctx->id=0;
00985                 return NULL;
00986         }
00987         if (close(ctx->sock))
00988         {
00989                 PERROR("close failed");
00990         }
00991         ctx->sock=0;
00992         ctx->id=0;
00993         return returned_tuple;
00994 }

01000 struct tuple *
01001 read_nb_tuple(struct tuple *template_tuple, struct context *ctx)
01002 {
01003         int op = READ_NB;
01004         struct tuple *received_tuple=0;
01005         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
01006                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
01007                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
01008         }
01009         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
01010                 PERROR("send failed");
01011                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
01012         }
01013         if (send_tuple(ctx, template_tuple)) {
01014                 PERROR("send_tuple failed");
01015                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
01016         }
01017         // Advise peer that we have stopped sending
01018         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
01019         DBGPRINTF("\n");
01020         received_tuple = recv_tuple(ctx);
01021         DBGPRINTF("received_tuple = %08x\n", (int) received_tuple);
01022         if (received_tuple == NULL) {
01023                 PERROR("recv_tuple failed");
01024                 return (struct tuple *) -1;
01025         }
01026         if (received_tuple == (struct tuple *) -1) {
01027                 if (close(ctx->sock))
01028                 {
01029                         PERROR("close failed");
01030                 }
01031                 ctx->sock=0;
01032                 ctx->id=0;
01033                 return NULL;
01034         }
01035         if (close(ctx->sock))
01036         {
01037                 PERROR("close failed");
01038         }
01039         ctx->sock=0;
01040         ctx->id=0;
01041         return received_tuple;
01042 }

01049 
01050 
01056 struct tuple_list *
01057 dump_tuple_space(struct tuple_list *templates, struct context *ctx)
01058 {
01059         int count, op = DUMP;
01060         struct tuple_list *s, *t, *tlist;
01061 
01062         for (count = 0, s = templates; s != NULL; count++, s = s->next);
01063 
01064         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
01065                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
01066                 return NULL;
01067         }
01068 
01069         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
01070                 PERROR("send failed");
01071                 return NULL;
01072         }
01073         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &count, sizeof(int))) {
01074                 PERROR("send failed");
01075                 return NULL;
01076         }
01077         s = templates;
01078         while (s) {
01079                 if (send_tuple(ctx, s->tup)) {
01080                         PERROR("send_tuple failed");
01081                         return NULL;
01082                 }
01083                 s = s->next;
01084         }
01085         /*
01086          * Do NOT free the templates. This guy may want to
01087          * use them again later. Let him free them.
01088          */
01089 
01090         tlist = NULL;
01091         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &count, sizeof(int))) {
01092                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
01093                 return NULL;
01094         }
01095         while (count--) {
01096                 struct tuple_list *x = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple_list));
01097                 if (x == NULL) {
01098                         /*
01099                          * ? ? ? ? 
01100                          */
01101                 }
01102                 x->tup = recv_tuple(ctx);
01103                 DBGPRINTF("x->tup = %08x\n", (int) x->tup);
01104                 if (x->tup == NULL) {
01105                         PERROR("recv_tuple failed");
01106                         return NULL;
01107                 }
01108                 if (x->tup == (struct tuple *) -1) {
01109                         PERROR("recv_tuple failed");
01110                         return NULL;
01111                 }
01112                 x->next = tlist;
01113                 tlist = x;
01114         }
01115 
01116         DBGPRINTF("tlist = %08x\n", (int) tlist);
01117         for (t = tlist; t != NULL;) {
01118                 DBGPRINTF("t = %08x\n", (int) t);
01119                 DBGPRINTF("t->tup = %08x\n", (int) t->tup);
01120                 DBGPRINTF("t->next = %08x\n", (int) t->next);
01121                 t = t->next;
01122         }
01123 
01124         return tlist;
01125 }
01126 
01127 
01133 int
01134 count_tuple_space(struct tuple_list *templates,
01135                   struct context *ctx, int *result)
01136 {
01137         int count, op = COUNT;
01138         struct tuple_list *s, *tlist;
01139 
01140         for (count = 0, s = templates; s != NULL; count++, s = s->next);
01141 
01142         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
01143                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
01144                 return 1;
01145         }
01146 
01147         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
01148                 PERROR("send failed");
01149                 return 1;
01150         }
01151         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &count, sizeof(int))) {
01152                 PERROR("send failed");
01153                 return 1;
01154         }
01155         s = templates;
01156         while (s) {
01157                 if (send_tuple(ctx, s->tup)) {
01158                         PERROR("send_tuple failed");
01159                         return 1;
01160                 }
01161                 s = s->next;
01162         }
01163         /*
01164          * Do NOT free the templates. This guy may want to
01165          * use them again later. Let him free them.
01166          */
01167 
01168         tlist = NULL;
01169         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) result, sizeof(int))) {
01170                 PERROR("recv_chunk failed");
01171                 return 1;
01172         }
01173 
01174         return 0;
01175 }
01176 
01177 
01181 int
01182 tuple_server_log(FILE * stream, struct context *ctx)
01183 {
01184         int n, op = LOG;
01185         const int bufsize = LOGBUFSIZE;
01186         char buf[bufsize];
01187 
01188         if (open_client_socket(ctx)) {
01189                 PERROR("open_client_socket failed");
01190                 return 1;
01191         }
01192         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &op, sizeof(int))) {
01193                 if (close(ctx->sock))
01194                 {
01195                         PERROR("close failed");
01196                 }       
01197                 ctx->sock=0;
01198                 ctx->id=0;
01199                 PERROR("send_chunk failed");
01200                 return 1;
01201         }
01202 
01203         n = read(ctx->sock, buf, bufsize);
01204         if (n < 0) {
01205                 PERROR("read failed");
01206                 return 1;
01207         }
01208         if (n > 0 && fwrite(buf, 1, n, stream) < n)
01209                 return 0;
01210         if (close(ctx->sock))
01211         {
01212                 PERROR("close failed");
01213         }
01214         ctx->sock=0;
01215         ctx->id=0;
01216         return 0;
01217 }

01224 
01228 static struct element *
01229 tuple_field(struct tuple *s, int n)
01230 {
01231         if (n >= s->num_elts) {
01232                 fprintf(stderr, "tuple_field() index too big (%d)\n", n);
01233                 fprintf(stderr, "tuple only has %d elements\n", s->num_elts);
01234                 EXIT();
01235         }
01236         return &s->elements[n];
01237 }
01238 
01239 
01243 int
01244 tuple_int_field(struct tuple *s, int n)
01245 {
01246         struct element *e;
01247         e = tuple_field(s, n);
01248         if (e->tag != 'i') {
01249                 fprintf(stderr,
01250                         "tuple_int_field: field %d is not an int\n", n);
01251                 fprintf(stderr, "Here is the tuple\n");
01252                 print_tuple(s);
01253                 logbuf[logptr] = '\0';
01254                 fprintf(stderr, logbuf);
01255                 EXIT();
01256         }
01257         return e->data.i;
01258 }
01259 
01260 
01264 double
01265 tuple_double_field(struct tuple *s, int n)
01266 {
01267         struct element *e;
01268         e = tuple_field(s, n);
01269         if (e->tag != 'd') {
01270                 fprintf(stderr,
01271                         "tuple_double_field: field %d is not a double\n", n);
01272                 fprintf(stderr, "Here is the tuple\n");
01273                 print_tuple(s);
01274                 logbuf[logptr] = '\0';
01275                 fprintf(stderr, logbuf);
01276                 EXIT();
01277         }
01278         return e->data.d;
01279 }

01281 
01285 char *
01286 tuple_string_field(struct tuple *s, int *len, int n)
01287 {
01288         struct element *e;
01289         e = tuple_field(s, n);
01290         if (e->tag != 's') {
01291                 fprintf(stderr,
01292                         "tuple_string_field: field %d is not a string\n", n);
01293                 fprintf(stderr, "Here is the tuple\n");
01294                 print_tuple(s);
01295                 logbuf[logptr] = '\0';
01296                 fprintf(stderr, logbuf);
01297                 EXIT();
01298         }
01299         if (len != NULL)
01300                 *len = e->data.s.len;
01301         return e->data.s.ptr;
01302 }

01308 struct tuple *
01309 tuple_tuple_field(struct tuple *s, int n)
01310 {
01311         struct element *e;
01312         e = tuple_field(s, n);
01313         if (e->tag != 't') {
01314                 fprintf(stderr,
01315                         "tuple_tuple_field: field %d is not a tuple\n", n);
01316                 fprintf(stderr, "Here is the tuple\n");
01317                 print_tuple(s);
01318                 logbuf[logptr] = '\0';
01319                 fprintf(stderr, logbuf);
01320                 EXIT();
01321         }
01322         return e->data.t;
01323 }
